newsitem.title: USA: Morrison Knudsen wins auto-plant contracts.
newsitem.headline: Morrison Knudsen wins auto-plant contracts.

text.p: Morrison Knudsen Corp said Wednesday it had been awarded contracts to oversee construction of plants being built in Poland and Thailand by General Motors Corp's Adam Opel AG unit.
Preliminary design of the facilities is under way, and completion of the metal fabrication and automobile assembly facilities is scheduled for late 1998 in Poland and early 1999 in Thailand.
Morrison Knudsen declined to give the value of the contracts, but industry sources say each plant will cost more than $100 million to build.
"We are delighted to again take MK's automotive expertise abroad to support our client's worldwide expansion," said Morrison Knudsen president and chief executive officer Robert Tinstman.
A spokesman for the Boise-based company said the contracts could be extended beyond completion of the factories if Opel chooses to retain Morrison Knudsen engineers to help manage the plants.
Under a bankruptcy reorganization plan, Morrison Knudsen is scheduled to be merged into Washington Construction Group Inc effective Sept. 11.
